section1.name: Birth Data Collection and Chart Casting

questions.question: Have you gathered the exact birth date, time, and place (latitude/longitude) of the individual?
questions.answer: Yes, all critical birth details have been gathered: exact birth date, time, and precise location coordinates. This data allows for accurate calculation of the Ascendant and planetary positions.

questions.question: Can you cast the Vedic birth chart (Kundli) with Rasi (D1) and Navamsa (D9) charts?
questions.answer: Yes, both essential charts have been successfully generated: Rasi (D1) and Navamsa (D9). The Rasi chart shows planetary positions in the 12 signs/houses at birth, while the Navamsa chart provides finer detail for marriage and destiny analysis.

questions.question: What is the Ascendant (Lagna) at birth?
questions.answer: The Ascendant (Lagna) is Aquarius at 1.08°. This sign was rising on the eastern horizon at the birth time/location, setting House 1 of the chart and anchoring the entire house structure.

ascendant.significance: Sets House 1 and anchors the entire house structure

questions.question: Which signs and houses are each of the nine planets in at birth?
questions.answer: All nine planets have been calculated: sun in Libra (9th house), moon in Aquarius (1st house), mars in Virgo (8th house), mercury in Libra (9th house), jupiter in Capricorn (12th house), venus in Virgo (8th house), saturn in Scorpio (10th house), rahu in Aries (3rd house), ketu in Libra (9th house). This forms the natal chart blueprint. Missing planets: Sun, Moon, Mars, Mercury, Jupiter, Venus, Saturn, Rahu, Ketu.

questions.question: Which Mahadasha is the person running from birth and what is the sequence of planetary periods?
questions.answer: Based on Moon's nakshatra (Shatabhisha), the person started with Saturn Mahadasha. Currently running Ketu Mahadasha (3.3 years remaining). Next: Venus Mahadasha starting at age 43.0. The complete 120-year Vimshottari cycle includes all 9 planets.
